background.title: Premise
problems_list: The manager forms the team without considering the psychological characteristics of the team members. This often leads to intra-team conflicts, reduced productivity, efficiency and the risk of employee leaving.

Lack of people with the necessary soft skills to effectively solve the necessary tasks, taking into account the specialization of the team, for example, sales, development (employees with different types of character, psychological portraits are required)
It is difficult to choose the right candidate for the team. It is necessary to consider not only the technical skills, but also the psychological characteristics of the candidate.
solutions_list: We give an understandable tool for solving these problems - TEAM CONSTRUCTOR
Each user must pass a small test and then we take over all calculations of intra-team interaction.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq_list: What methodology was used to build the settlement system?

To develop the test methodology, our team took as a basis more than 40 years of research by L. N. Sobchik, while the form of the test is understandable and based on the American school of psychology. Compatibility is calculated on the basis of the works of R. Ackoff and F. Emery, who developed a theory of the combination of the intensity of display of personal qualities.
Where was the data taken to build the model?

Data for building the model was taken from numerous experiments carried out on real teams. The model is based on more than 10 years of experience in applying the model in neuromarketing and dozens of successful cases. Now we want to apply this model to HR services.
No, this is not a horoscope. Try our free test and see how accurately it describes your personality
Why should people show their character to others?

Our mission is that a person at work is perceived not only as a function, but also as a personality. The more accurately we can describe the preferences and aspirations of a person, the more comfortable team he/she can find for him/herself.
